title: Clowdbot Blog
description: Guides on hosting OpenClaw in the cloud — pricing, security, and infrastructure analysis from the Clowdbot team.

posts.title: When Your AI Assistant Can Generate Images, Music, and Video
posts.excerpt: Most AI assistants are text in, text out. What changes when assistants can generate images, music, video, run code, and take actions?

posts.title: The Real Cost of Running OpenClaw: Hosting, API Keys, and Hidden Complexity
posts.excerpt: The software is free under an MIT license. So what does it actually cost to run? The honest answer has three layers.

posts.title: What Running OpenClaw Locally Actually Means for Your Machine
posts.excerpt: Running OpenClaw locally gives you full control — but it also means you are responsible for security, updates, API keys, and infrastructure.

posts.title: Startups Are Vectors, Not Scalars
posts.excerpt: Startups don't take off on their own. Founders push them off the ground. The unscalable work isn't a necessary evil—it often is the business at that stage.

posts.title: Measurement and Leverage
posts.excerpt: To get rich, you need measurement and leverage. Startups provide both through smallness and technology.

posts.title: The Meeting Isn't the Problem. The Schedule Is.
posts.excerpt: Meetings don't cost everyone the same amount. There are two incompatible operating systems for time, and confusing them destroys maker productivity.

posts.title: You Won't Get Rich Renting Out Your Time
posts.excerpt: Wealth is assets that earn while you sleep. You will never get rich trading hours for dollars. Real wealth requires owning equity.

posts.title: The Struggle Is Not Failure
posts.excerpt: The Struggle is not failure—but it causes failure. Every great entrepreneur went through it. Surviving it is where greatness originates.

posts.title: Your Brain Has Systematic Bugs
posts.excerpt: Even people who understand incentives underestimate their power. The forces that distort human judgment are stronger than your awareness of them.

posts.title: Hello, World
posts.excerpt: Welcome to the Clowdbot blog. We're writing for humans and agents alike—and we're curious what that means.
